title: Calories in 8 oz Ribeye Steak
meta_description: Discover calories in ribeye steak 8 oz, including protein, fat, carbs, full nutrition breakdown per 100 g basis, and simple tweaks for your meal.
assumptions: Boneless ribeye steak, cooked (grilled), with moderate marbling and fat trimmed to 1/8 inch; no added oils or seasonings.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by cut, marbling, cooking method, and trimming; values are averages. Check labels or sources for specifics.

quick_answer.text: An 8 oz cooked ribeye steak provides ~660 kcal and ~55 g protein.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison with packaging.

faqs.q: How many calories in an 8 oz ribeye steak?
faqs.a: Approximately 660 kcal for a cooked, moderately marbled 8 oz ribeye steak.

faqs.q: What's the protein in 8 oz ribeye steak?
faqs.a: About 55 g of protein, making it a high-protein option.
No carbs, fiber, or sugarsâ€”it's primarily protein and fat.

faqs.q: How does cooking method affect calories in ribeye steak?
faqs.a: Grilling or broiling keeps calories lower; frying or adding fats increases them by 40-100 kcal.

faqs.q: Is 8 oz ribeye high in saturated fat?
faqs.a: Yes, around 21 g saturated fat due to marbling; opt for trimming to reduce it.
